awd_abstract_narration: The Marine Sciences Program at the University of North                          Carolina will acquire several items of laboratory                               instrumentation to be placed in an inventory of shared use                      equipment.  This equipment is maintained for use by all                         investigators and will especially benefit NSF-sponsored                         research projects by increasing the capabilities of the                         institution to support research and engineering activities.                     The instrumentation includes:                                                                                                                                   -a research quality autoclave for sterilizing scientific                          apparatus, and                                                                -a scintillation counter for measuring trace amounts of                           radio-active elements used in a variety of experiments.                                                                                                       The instrumentation described above will increase the                           capability of the organization to support several diverse                       NSF-sponsored research and engineering projects that are                        underway and proposed.

inst.inst_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA AT CHAPEL HILL
